nodes.bodyText: I'd suggest getDebugMessage or getDumpMessage if this is only used for dumping. getString doesn't sound very informative...
In this case the string it returns is describing the contents of the tick manager. So really, it's a bit like a toString method for dumps. toDumpString?

nodes.bodyText: What's a dump string? How is different from getDebugString?
a dumped string, as shown in debug command dump.
What does "area" mean here? What's the "horizontal size" and why isn't it determined by start and end positions?

nodes.bodyText:
The area is a BlockBox used for positioning structures. I've revised the parameters a bit, but basically the values are:
pos = Pos1 of the box. This is the pos parameter passed down from other methods.
size = Width/Height/Depth of the box (passed down as the size of the structure)
margin = Extra margin to expend the area by along the X+Z axis.
The final box's dimensions are calculated as follows:
min = pos - [margin, 3, margin]
max = pos + size + [margin - 1, 30, margin - 1]
